description: The Income Tax Department has launched a fresh campaign targeting individuals with undeclared overseas assets and income.  Around 25,000 high-risk cases will be initially contacted via SMS and email. This initiative aims to encourage taxpayers to review and revise their returns by December 31 to avoid significant penalties under the Black Money Act.

The court also directed comedians to host shows featuring SMA achievers, contributing earnings to patient treatment.

Except the BJP, all parties, including the ruling Trinamool Congress, are opposing the exercise, though they are participating in the process. description: Tragedy struck near the White House as a National Guard soldier, Sarah Beckstrom, succumbed to injuries from a shooting. President Trump announced her death, stating the second soldier is critically wounded. The alleged attacker, an Afghan national with prior CIA ties, is also injured and will face severe repercussions. The incident prompted lockdowns of nearby federal buildings.

title: Centre announces scheme to promote research in textiles

title: IND vs SA: 'The biggest fault' - Harbhajan Singh lashes out at Team India
description: South Africa dominated the Test through strong batting contributions led by Senuran Muthusamy’s maiden century and Marco Jansen’s explosive 93. Jansen, who also took 6/48 in the first innings, dismantled India’s batting order before Simon Harmer completed the rout with a match-winning 6/37 in the second innings.  South Africa sealed a commanding 408-run win, with Harmer finishing as Player of the Series for his 17 wickets across two Tests, while Jansen claimed the Player of the Match award for his all-round brilliance.

description: The Supreme Court has directed the Information and Broadcasting Ministry to draft a mechanism for pre-screening user-generated content on social media. The court emphasized the need for a preventive measure to curb the rapid spread of potentially damaging or anti-national content before it goes viral, acknowledging the limitations of post-takedown actions.

title: Multi-layered problem: Why no Indians made Candidates 2026 via Goa WC
description: Uzbekistan's Javokhir Sindarov, a 19-year-old, became the youngest World Cup winner, securing a spot in the 2026 Candidates. India, hosting the event after 23 years, saw its 24 players fail to reach the top three qualifying spots. The article explores the knockout format's challenges, home advantage pressures, and the impact of chess engines on creativity.

This sweeping directive demands sworn affidavits on their establishment, governance, regulatory approvals, and non-profit status, aiming to expose structural opacity and assess regulatory oversight.

title: Delhi blast probe: Muzammil stored explosives in shed; NIA traces two more hideouts
description: Investigators uncovered two more hideouts linked to Al-Falah University professor Muzammil Ahmad Ganaie, who was making IEDs. He had stored 2,600kg of ammonium nitrate at a mosque shed before moving it to a cleric's house, from where it was seized just before the Delhi blast.

title: Who was Fuzzy Zoeller? Two-time major champion golfer dies at 74
description: Golf legend Fuzzy Zoeller, the last player to win the Masters on his debut in 1979 and a 1984 U.S. Open champion, has passed away at 74. Known for his personality and memorable moments, Zoeller's career also included a notable controversy in 1997. He leaves behind a legacy of significant wins and sportsmanship.

title: Who is Jack White? Eminem teams up with rock legend for Thanksgiving halftime show
description: Detroit's own rock legend Jack White is set to electrify the Thanksgiving halftime show during the Packers vs. Lions game. Known for his iconic guitar riffs and hits like "Seven Nation Army," White promises a high-energy performance celebrating hometown pride.  Executive-produced with input from Eminem, the show blends nostalgia and local flavor, also supporting Feeding America.

title: Legal notice to Mumbai Police for failure to file FIR against BJP city president for hate speech
description: Days ago, Mumbai BJP Chief, Mr. Satam, stirred controversy after he said that Mumbai will not tolerate the “imposition of a Khan”

title: No dent in pollution as court orders not followed, SC told
description: The Supreme Court acknowledged its limitations in tackling Delhi-NCR's air pollution, stating it lacks a 'magic wand.' Decades of judicial intervention have yielded minimal results, with authorities failing to implement past orders. The court emphasized the need for long-term, year-round solutions involving domain experts and coordinated government efforts, rather than just winter-specific actions.

title: New footage shows Kneeland’s pregnant girlfriend handcuffed before his death
description: New footage reveals Marshawn Kneeland's pregnant girlfriend, Catalina Mancera, was handcuffed after police stopped her vehicle, which matched the one they were pursuing. She reportedly told officers Kneeland was suicidal and refused to disclose his location. The Dallas Cowboys are establishing a memorial fund to financially support Mancera and their unborn child.

title: ‘India’s space leap’: PM inaugurates Skyroot Infinity campus; Vikram-I commercial rocket unveiled
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Skyroot Aerospace's new Infinity campus in Hyderabad. He also unveiled Vikram-I, India's first commercial orbital rocket. This marks a significant step for India's private space sector. Skyroot aims to launch Vikram-I within two months. The company is creating high-tech jobs and plans further investment. India is becoming a global leader in satellite launches.

description: India has released a new earthquake map. The entire Himalayan region is now in the highest risk zone. Over 60% of India faces moderate to high earthquake hazards. Police are investigating, reviewing CCTV footage, and seeking to identify the armed attackers.

Despite a large purse, UP Warriorz made strategic signings, while surprising unsold names included Alyssa Healy and Alana King. A total of 67 players were acquired.

South Africa's President Ramaphosa refuted these claims, calling them baseless and from a fringe group. The G-20's consensus-based nature makes unilateral expulsion unlikely, despite escalating global political tensions.

Even with projected revenue growth and subscriber increases, the company will likely need substantial new capital.

CIA link, Afghan evacuee: Details emerge of White House shooter; what made him turn to terror?
description: An Afghan man who worked with US forces in Afghanistan is accused of a violent attack in Washington. He had been resettled in the US after the war. This incident has led to a halt in Afghan asylum and refugee processing. The move impacts thousands of families. It also raises concerns among Afghan communities and US veterans who supported them.

title: Critical shift: India to open nuclear sector to pvt players? What PM said
description: India is set to open its nuclear energy sector to private companies. This move aims to boost energy security and technological advancement. The government plans to increase nuclear power capacity significantly by 2047. A new bill will be introduced to facilitate this major policy shift. This reform follows the successful opening of the space sector to private players.

title: Nifty50, Sensex hit lifetime highs: What's driving rally & is it sustainable? Explained
description: Stock market at record high! Nifty50 has crossed 26,300 and Sensex has gone past 86,000 for the first time. There is renewed optimism about the Indian stock markets - but is the current rally sustainable? Here's what experts have to say:

title: Building Bengaluru 2.0: City bets whopping Rs 1.5 lakh crore on its infrastructure
description: Bengaluru plans a massive Rs 1.5 lakh crore infrastructure overhaul to become a global metropolis. The ambitious project includes urban tunnels, elevated roads, metro expansion, and improved waste and water management. While aiming to ease traffic, critics question its car-centric approach and environmental impact, advocating for greater public transport investment.

title: Blood sugar experts reveal daily home habits to prevent type 2 diabetes
description: Protecting your family from Type 2 diabetes hinges on daily habits, not just clinics. Doctors emphasize that simple actions like moving together, eating well, managing stress, limiting screen time and prioritising 7-8 hours of sleep can significantly slash risks. This approach is crucial as diabetes now affects all ages across the world.

title: It wasn’t easy”: Gisele Bündchen opens up about shock over Brady’s past
description: Supermodel Gisele Bundchen revealed the shock of discovering Tom Brady's ex was pregnant just two months into their relationship. Despite this, they married and she embraced his son, Jack. After over a decade of marriage, the couple announced their separation in October 2022, with Bundchen now a mother again and Brady reportedly single.

title: Candace Owens pulls show, claims Macron tried to harm her after Kirk’s death
description: Candace Owens has halted her show, alleging French President Macron plotted her assassination, a claim she reported to the White House and US counterterrorism teams. She also implicated the Macrons in Charlie Kirk's death. These accusations surface amidst a defamation lawsuit filed by the Macrons against Owens for her claims about Brigitte Macron's gender identity.

title: 'Only one will win': Mark Cuban warns AI giants— 'overspending bubble could pop'
description: Mark Cuban has cautioned major AI firms like OpenAI and Google against excessive spending in the race for the most powerful models. He likens the current AI arms race to the 1990s search engine boom, predicting a potential bubble and winner-take-all outcome. Cuban believes true disruption will emerge from unexpected breakthroughs, not just incremental improvements.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250B; claims 'we lead industry'
description: Nvidia's dominance in AI chips faced a significant challenge as Meta reportedly considers billions in spending on Google's competing AI processors. This news sent Nvidia's stock plummeting, while Alphabet's shares climbed. Google's TPUs are emerging as a credible alternative, potentially disrupting Nvidia's market hold.
